ygData.subject: Re: [NBWRPG]  Election
ygData.msgSnippet: Wait. Second thought, that sucked. Here we go. Alloran joined this RPG the same time I did. We ve both known the hardships of working in the RPG and not

From: "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@...>

Wait. Second thought, that sucked. Here we go. Alloran joined this RPG the
same time I did. We've both known the hardships of working in the RPG and
not getting everything explained properly, the way it should be. Finally,
when we learned, we both found ourselves still being harrassed for all the
wrong reasons. KSLawdogg arranged one of Alloran's character's death because
he didn't like organics. Alloran has been the most patient, kindhearted
person I've ever known. I once got mad at him when he told me that he had a
character named Snare and I took offense to it. But he instantly made me
feel like a mean spirited person by actually showing his bigness and telling
me that he didn't mean any harm. Alloran is not someone you would have to
argue with. The way he explains things tells it all. You won't get beaten
down verbally for asking him a question he doesn't like or accidentally
mode. He'll merely state the problem and you'll find yourself with a good
RPGer, who doubles as a fantastic person and friend, with extreme patience
and understanding. Alloran would never treat himself superior over anyone,
and will never insult your family because of some lame reason like "you
mode" or "I don't like you, I never have," he's truly your best choice for
council member. And he's got my vote...

----- Original Message -----
From: "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, April 30, 2001 11:39 PM
Subject: Re: [NBWRPG] Election


> OOC: Vote for Alloran, because he really cares. Enough said...
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <KSLawdogg@...>
> To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Monday, April 30, 2001 6:34 PM
> Subject: Re: [NBWRPG] Election
>
>
> > (As long as we're spreading our respective propagandas around, vote for
> me.
> > Why?  I was signed onto the Council not even a several weeks after
joining
> > the RPG because I deserved it, because of my skill and experience, and
my
> > ideas, which I still bring to the RPG.  My moding enforcement I can
> happily
> > say doesn't exist becuase there is no longer a need for it.
> >
> > This new Council seems like things will actually happen instead of
making
> a
> > suggestion and everyone says "Oh, good idea." and nothing happens.
Though
> > with this new Council, and if I'm on it, good things will happen, rules
> that
> > will help out the "little guys".  If elected some of my rules may seem
> > hipocritical since one or two I may be guilty of (and I'm not the only
> one),
> > but that is how you learn.  Through experience, which I've got 5+ years
of
> > online RPing experience, all in RPGs very similar to this.  I may seem
> harsh
> > at times, but I'm only acting in the best interests of the RPG.
> >
> > So vote for the KSLawDogg@...
> >
> > -Uni
> >
> > (Just want to say right now thanks to my loyal supporters, your aid has
> been
> > most helpful and I'm most appreciative)
